title: LA-20-07: Answers to Frequently Asked Questions for Employees Engaged in Crowdsourced Fundraising
url: https://www.oge.gov/Web/oge.nsf/Legal Docs/B97946E02378A576852585FA00522E03/$FILE/LA-20-07 Answers to Frequently Asked Questions for Employees Engaged in Crowdsourced Fundraising.pdf?open
summary:
This Legal Advisory provides answers to frequently asked questions for employees engaged in crowdsourced fundraising. The advisory addresses a range of topics, including determining when gifts are based on an employee's official position and accepting donations from fundraising campaigns started by others. 

Notes: [Notes: (1) Executive Order 13770, which is cited in footnote 31, has been revoked. Executive Order 13989 contains an identical provision (sec. 1, para. 1). (2) Among other changes to the Standards of Conduct effective August 15, 2024, OGE updated language to make clear that the 2635.302(b) restriction on accepting gifts from employees receiving less pay does not apply to a gift from a superior to a subordinate employee. See 89 FR 43686 and LA-24-06.]
